title: Nate Silver - Wikipedia
snippet: I am excited to talk to Nate when he finishes his book tour about ways to expand that kind of reporting." On July 22, 2013, ESPN (a subsidiary of the Walt Disney Company) announced that it had acquired ownership of the FiveThirtyEight website and brand, and that "Silver will serve as editor-in-chief of the site and will build a team of journalists, editors, analysts and contributors in the coming months."

title: FiveThirtyEight - Wikipedia
snippet: In August 2010, the blog became a licensed feature of The New York Times online and was renamed FiveThirtyEight: Nate Silver's Political Calculus. In July 2013, ESPN acquired FiveThirtyEight, hiring Silver as editor-in-chief and a contributor for ESPN.com; the new publication launched on March ...

title: A few words about FiveThirtyEight - by Nate Silver
snippet: The FiveThirtyEight.com homepage as of its relaunch under ESPN/Disney on March 17, 2014. title: Nate Silver Bio - Detroit Regional Chamber
snippet: A diehard baseball fan, Silver is also credited with developing PECOTA (Player Empirical Comparison and Optimization Test Algorithm), a statistical formula for predicting a player’s performance. title: Nate Silver - Podcast Host - Pushkin Industries
snippet: Nate Silver, co-host of the Risky Business podcast, is the founder and former editor-in-chief (2008-2023) of FiveThirtyEight, which was published by The New York Times, ESPN, and ABC News.
